column1: Facebook Inc (FB) TV App Is More Trouble Than You Think;2/1/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) opened for trade Feb. 1 at an all-time high - a market cap of $365 billion - on the strength of its dominance in mobile apps. But the big news is that Facebook is about to challenge the video league leaders with a mobile app for existing streaming boxes like theApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) TV. The question is
column3: what will this do for FB stock?makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockMoving into TV through an app rather than a device makes sense
column4: given the failure of the original Facebook phone and its overwhelming success with apps for others' phones.FB is already bankrolling the creation of videos for the video tab of itsmobile app.So where does Facebook fit its service into the evolving market
column5: and what does its presence as a broadcaster mean to its claims not to be a media company?FB Stock: TV vs. PhoneThe company is already a presence in video thanks toFacebook Live
column6: which allows live streaming of video on the service and it has aPresidential endorsement.10 Stocks to Buy That Already Make America GreatFB has prepared to offer longer videos by introducing ""mid-roll"" ads - ads that play in the middle of a video - to its line-up
column7: making the service more TV-like.Over time
column8: this might allow Facebook to compete directly withAmazon.com
column9: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN)
column10: Netflix
column11: Inc.(NASDAQ:NFLX) andAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOG
column12: NASDAQ:GOOGL) YouTube in the growing market for streaming services.The problem is that there is a big difference between the experience you get on a mobile phone and what you want on a TV screen. A phone is active
column13: a TV is passive. A phone may support videos of a few minutes
column14: while people will watch TV for hours-and-hours.There is an assumption in the breathless reporting of Facebook's latest move that TV is easy; that it's just something you throw money at. Given the success of Netflix in generating subscribers and Emmys
column15: and Amazon in generating Prime members and Oscar buzz
column16: that is an easy mistake to make.Worth the Candle?For Facebook stock
column17: this may not be as huge a deal as analysts think.Netflix revenue is only a fraction of FB stock's. Analysts expect Facebook to deliver over $27 billion in 2016 revenue when it reports after the market closes Feb. 1. This is against roughly $9 billion for Netflix. NFLX also brings just 3% of that revenue to the bottom line
column18: while FB stock brings nearly one-third of revenue to its net income line.Entering the world of creating television poses another risk. CEO Mark Zuckerberg has repeatedly saidhe doesn't run a media company
column19: that his is just a communications service. Media companies have responsibilities to truth and accuracy that
column20: say
column21: phone companies don't have - responsibilitiesthat can limit profitability.If Facebook is going to license content from media suppliers
column22: whether live or scripted
column23: it becomes a media company
column24: subject to political and public scrutiny for its programming choices
column25: on a global basis. This is a dance FB stock shareholders should fear
column26: because it costs money to play
column27: and carries risk.Can Facebook Inc (FB) Stock Jump Over These Hurdles?But Facebook may now have no choice in the matter. The big screen is the last frontier for internet services
column28: it's where everyone is heading. FB stock does not want to be left behind.The Bottom Line on Facebook StockWhile most analysts are jumping for joy over the Facebook TV app news
column29: I am a lot more cautious. This move has enormous implications for the entire company
column30: for how it's perceived and (more important) what it costs to run.FB
column31: like Alphabet
column32: prefers to manage itself through algorithms. Algorithms scale in ways people do not. Facebook is starting to bow to pressure on the media front
column33: hiring Campbell Brownto coordinate media alliances. Now it's about to become a TV network
column34: or at least a streaming service.What will that mean to its profitability and growth? I think they both slow
column35: because people aren't algorithms and talent has temper that code does not have. Politics can kill the media star.Dana Blankenhornis a financial and technology journalist. He is the author of the sci-fi novellaInto the Cloud
column36: available at the Amazon Kindle store. Write him atdanablankenhorn@gmail.comor follow him on Twitter at@danablankenhorn. As of this writing he owned shares in AMZN

column1: Will the Apple Inc. HomeKit Beat Amazon’s Alexa? (AAPL);2/1/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) announced HomeKit - its strategy for becoming the center of the smart home - in June 2014.Amazon.com
column3: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) revealed its Alexa-powered Echo smart speaker that November.makeArticleAd();Source: Apple/AmazonWhile there are currently several dozen HomeKit compatible smart home products
column4: Amazon's Alexa is now connected to thousands of smart products and services and has spread from the Echo to third-party devices.On the surface
column5: it looks as though Amazon has outmaneuvered and thoroughly trounced Apple. But despite the seemingly insurmountable lead and momentum
column6: AAPL could still end up beating AMZN in this smart home race.Here's how.Apple Chose the Closed Approach With HomeKitApple tends to be extremely cautious. Its software is designed to be user-friendly and secure. iPhone apps can't just be downloaded from anywhere; they need to go through the official App Store and that requires approval by AAPL. Third-party hardware needs to be certified by Apple before it can be marketed as being iOS-compatible.It's that ""walled"" approach that hasmade the iPhone more securethan smartphones runningAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOGL) Android operating system.With the iPhone and Siri - Apple's voice assistant - at the center of Apple's smart home strategy
column7: that focus on security
column8: compatibility and ease of use carried over toHomeKit. Manufacturers who want to make their smart devices HomeKit-compatible face a daunting series of requirements.Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Has a New Hero: Services!As pointed out in a recent Reuters article ondiffering smart home approaches
column9: this includes being forced to buy a special HomeKit chip
column10: being limited to approved (and more expensive than average) Bluetooth and Wi-Fi chips and even extends to manufacturing being limited to factories that are certified by Apple. End-to-end encryption is mandatory. Once a HomeKit product is ready
column11: it faces extensive testing by Apple engineers to ensure compatibility.Thenit may be sold. That process alone can take three to five months.So you have additional costs
column12: the procedural red tape and a delay. It's easy to understand whyApple currently lists only 75 or so HomeKit-compatible devices. And half of those are either different color options or regional variations of the same product.Amazon Alexa Is Open for BusinessAmazon took a radically different approach with its Echo speaker and Alexa. The company openly courted third-party companies to develop Alexa ""skills"" or software-enabled interactions with an Amazon Alexa-powered device.A skill can be the ability to tell Alexa to order anUber. It could also be telling Alexa to turn on your home's smart lights or to start your electric car. The process is simple. Amazon provides an example showinghow to build an Alexa skill in 60 minutes
column13: and that includes the time needed to create a developer account. Submit the skill to AMZN for a quick verification
column14: and it's published.That's how Amazon Alexa tripled its available skills in just three months last year
column15: hitting 3
column16: 000 in September. If that sounds impressive
column17: by CES 2017 in January
column18: it had hit more than 7
column19: 000 Alexa skills.In addition to skills
column20: Amazon also encourages third parties to integrate Alexa functionality into their products. That way
column21: consumers get the Alexa experience without requiring an Echo speaker.That's a far easier process than Apple HomeKit certification. A ""Works with Alexa"" label takes about 10 days to obtain (it can even be issued by third party labs) and doesn't require special chips. According to the Reuters post
column22: that has resulted in over 250 products that are Alexa-certified. We saw some of these at CES
column23: including third-party speakers with Alexa and even home appliances with built-in Alexa capability.Smart Home Security: Apple Strength
column24: Amazon Alexa VulnerabilityThe differing approaches of AMZN and AAPL have led to Alexa rapidly leaping to a massive lead over HomeKit in the smart home. However
column25: there is one scenario where this could change rapidly.Security is increasingly becoming an issue for smart
column26: connected devices. Apple's HomeKit approach emphasizes security
column27: to the point of forcing the use of specialized chips and even certified manufacturing facilities.Amazon's Alexa strategy
column28: on the other hand
column29: leaves its platform relatively exposed. Amazon told Reuters it can't guarantee the security of third-party devices running Alexa. Those thousands of Alexa skills also integrate with third-party services that may have their own vulnerabilities.Trade of the Day: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock No Longer a Home RunAll it would take is one catastrophic hacking for a PR disaster that turns consumers off Alexa. As CNET puts it in a review of thehacking risks for different smart home standards: ""Don't assume that a device has high security standards just because it works with Alexa.""Bottom LineThere's no disputing the fact that Amazon completely caught Apple and others off guard with its stealthy approach of sneaking Alexa into the home using its Echo connected speaker.Before the Echo
column30: it was generally assumed that a smartphone would be the natural smart home controller. Making Alexa integration so open has also paid off for AMZN
column31: resulting in a formidable lead in the smart home in a very short time. That lead may well turn into complete domination of the connected home. But Amazon's open approach may also prove to be its Achilles heel.Should hackers turn their attention to Amazon Alexa
column32: the resulting headlines may flip the equation and put the much more secure Apple HomeKit on top in the long run.As of this writing
column33: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceApple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Pops Following Vindicating Q1 EarningsFriday Apple Rumors: Designer Creates Interesting iPhone 8 ConceptCan Apple Inc. (AAPL) Afford a War With Qualcomm
column34: Inc. (QCOM)?The postWill the Apple Inc. HomeKit Beat Amazon's Alexa? (AAPL)appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: What Apple's (AAPL) Earnings Say About The Future;2/1/2017;"When you regularly give your opinion on something as unpredictable as financial markets
column2: gloating when you get something right is rarely a good idea. That is especially true when those opinions arearchivedfor all to see; it's too easy for a reader to check out that archive and find examples of when the market and hindsight combine to make even logical arguments seem foolish. I am fully aware of that
column3: but when it comes to yesterday’searnings release from Apple(AAPL)
column4: I will still say""told you!""What really matters about the Apple release to investors is certainly not that I got it right
column5: nor is it even that the tech giant returned to growth in revenue for the first time in a year
column6: nor that the already great margins at Apple increased. Those last two are important
column7: but necessarily backward looking
column8: as all hard data in an earnings release are by definition.What matters most is what the report tells us about the future and there the message was somewhat mixed.makeArticleAd();The official guidance for Q1 2017 contained in the release fell just short of Wall Street’s expectations
column9: which would normally be enough of a negative to more than offset the good historical results. In this case
column10: though
column11: a look at where Apple succeeded in Q4 2016 suggests that that guidance may just be another example of Apple’s past tendency to err on the side of under-promising and over-delivering when it comes to guidance. That is why
column12: even though growth stalled last year
column13: AAPL has beaten EPS expectations in three of the last four quarters.First and foremost
column14: iPhone sales hit another record. That is particularly significant as not that long ago many were predicting that Google parent Alphabet (GOOG:GOOGL)’s move into the phone business would do Apple some serious harm. It looks now as if those saying that were about as accurate as those that maintained that the Windows phone from Microsoft (MSFT) or the Amazon (AMZN) Fire phone would be the next big thing.The fact is that the iPhone has an iconic status that looks almost impossible to challenge. Even phones that are objectively better in some ways
column15: such as memory capacity
column16: camera resolution
column17: or speaker quality for example
column18: cannot take market share. As Apple advances the iPhone with each release
column19: beating them on those and other fronts becomes harder
column20: but remains
column21: according to the evidence so far
column22: a pointless exercise. As long as that dynamic remains
column23: holding Apple stock and adding to holdings at times of weakness still makes sense for investors.The weakness in this release was mainly in one area; iPad sales declined for the twelfth successive quarter. That
column24: however
column25: was offset to some extent by strong sales of Macs and Apple Watches. For the latter we are reliant on the word of Tim Cook as Apple doesn’t release a breakdown of watch sales
column26: but
column27: as I pointed out in the article referenced above
column28: anybody who tried to buy a Series Two watch as a Christmas gift is probably aware that sales were at least more than Apple expected. None were available in any of the five states where I tried and most stores have just now received inventory.That shortage of watches
column29: combined with Cook’s admission that they seriously underestimated demand for the iPhone 7 Plus
column30: means that the record sales reported yesterday were achieved with a background of supply constraints. Given that and the fact that there was considerable growth in areas such as services and enterprise operations that still have lots of room for Apple to expand
column31: the message underlying yesterday’s earnings is that
column32: despite conventional wisdom
column33: growth can still be achieved."

column5: the biotech giant topped analysts' expectation in each of the first three quarters of 2016. Chances are that it'll top expectations once more when it reports its fourth-quarter and full-year 2016 figures on Feb. 2. So if you're following AMGN stock

column7: you'll want to watch the following items Thursday when Amgen reports its fourth-quarter results:#1: Enbrel Sales TrendCompared to the third quarter of 2015
column8: Amgen reported flat product sales in Q3 2016. This was mostly due to its top-selling drug
column9: Enbrel
column10: losing ground. Sales for the drug had increased 24% in Q1 and 10% in Q2
column11: but in the third quarter
column12: total Enbrel sales were $1.452 billion
column13: versus $1.459 billion in the year-ago period.The problem doesn't seem to be seasonal fluctuation

column15: compared to Q3 2014.7 Awful Stocks You Need To Ditch Right AwayThe problem is that competition is catching up. Amgen usually says
column16: ""offset partially by the impact of competition"" when giving details about Enbrel sales. However
column18: ""partially"" was conspicuously absent. Did someone just forget to copy-and-paste? Maybe. Maybe not.AMGN stock holders should pay attention to see if Enbrel will resume growth through increased volume
column19: as opposed to price hike.Enbrel faces three major growth barriers.First
column20: it competes againstAbbVie Inc's(NYSE:ABBV) Humira and Johnson & Johnson's Remicade. This leads to the second challenge.Stiff competition necessitates incremental rebates to payers to maintain its formulary position.The third challenge is the biosimilar availability. For instance
column21: the FDA has approved Erelzi
column22: an Enbrel biosimilar byNovartis AG (ADR)(NYSE:NVS).Put simply
column23: further lackluster Enbrel growth would weigh on AMGN stock.#2: Amgen's Drug PricingInvestors also should look closely at how fast Amgen is hiking prices.I raised concerns about Amgen stockgrowing sales by increasing drug prices
column24: instead of higher volumes
column25: after the company reported its Q2 2015 earnings. Almost two years on
column26: the trend of growing sales with price hikes is still commonplace at AMGN.From a business perspective
column27: it's smart to try to squeeze out every possible dollar from your inventions. However
column28: the U.S. government is standing up against it. President Donald Trump told drugmakers in aJan. 31 meetingthat ""we have to get the prices down.""This won't be good for the top and bottom lines of any drugmaker. However
column29: for a company who thrives on hiking drug prices like AMGN
column30: the downside gets bigger.#3: How Did Repatha Perform?Repatha is heralded as potentially one of Amgen's best sellers. The company said the drug caters to ""serious diseases with significant unmet needs."" However
column31: it brought in a meager $40 million in Q3.One barrier to market growth is that payers have employed utilization-management procedures
column32: which limited patients' ability to gain access to Repatha. Execs said during Q3 earnings call that they're working with payers and providers to allow unlabeled patient access. Investors should look to see if collaborations with payers and providers are yielding significant Repatha growth.Alphabet Inc (GOOGL): The Cheapest $800 Stock I KnowThe drug
column33: which currently competes withSanofiSA (ADR)(NYSE:SNY) andRegeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc's(NASDAQ:REGN) Praluent
column34: had a 55% share of new-to-brand prescriptions (NBRx) in Q4
column35: according to an Amgen presentation at this year's JPMorgan Healthcare Conference. Still

column1: Alphabet Inc (GOOGL): The Cheapest $800 Stock I Know;2/1/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsDisruption is everywhere.Amazon.com
column3: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) disrupts how we shop
column4: whileAirbnbdisrupts where we stay.Tesla Motors Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA) disrupts what we drive
column5: andUbereven disruptswhetherwe drive. If a teen with 2 million Instagram followers can disrupt how billion-dollar businesses find customers
column6: the rest of us need to dive in and start swimming … or at least buy the one stock which has its hands in all of the above:Alphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL).makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockSimply put
column7: GOOGL stock is the most innovative
column8: most disruptive and cheapest $800 equity I know.Let me explain.Silicon Valley money manager Michael Moe and his team at GSV Asset Management produce a provocative weekly newsletter dedicated to highlighting where they think the world is going. While doing research for myBullseye Brief
column9: one of their recent pieces got me thinking about innovation in more tangible terms. The team ranked eight global technology companies based on their involvement across 22 cutting-edge categories. Hands down
column10: Alphabet ranks No. 1
column11: capturing 21 of 22.Innovation LeadersCuriously
column12: all eight GSV-highlighted companies have dedicated efforts in the areas of artificial intelligence
column13: big data and cloud services
column14: making these three the Holy Grail of innovation.The first two come as no surprise
column15: as data gathering and analysis are critical to predicting behavior
column16: enabling companies to target consumers accordingly. Web services
column17: which is now the fastest-growing segment for Amazon
column18: is less obvious but nonetheless a clear indicator these innovators want to get bigger by serving as the backbone for other companies.10 Stocks to Buy That Already Make America GreatThis is key
column19: and since Google already commands 49% of the global online advertising market according to Pivotal Research analyst Brian Wieser
column20: I'll bet on GOOGL.MoonshotMuch of Google's innovative efforts happen at its off-site research center called Google X
column21: aka the Moonshot Factory. It's run by a futurist named Astro Teller
column22: and I highly recommend hisTED Talkexplaining how Google X approaches innovation:Identify a problem affecting millions of people.Find or propose a radical solution for solving that problem.Move full speed ahead if there's reason to believe technology for such a radical solution could actually be built.He says Google X people spend most of their time ""breaking things and trying to prove they're wrong"" but believes that's their secret … what makes Googlers different. By ""killing"" more projects than they approve
column23: their success rate rises. Alphabet spent $13.8 billion last year on research and development - the second highest number of any company in the world behind Amazon
column24: and second highest as a percentage of sales among the eight innovation leaders.R&D as % of RevenueAlphabet invests a staggering amount of money to fund R&D
column25: both because it can and because it has to. With three times more online advertising than its next closest competitor
column26: GOOGL is a cash cow.By the same token
column27: it has significant overlap with all seven competitors in the most obvious categories - like robotics and AI- and each of these companies is hungry to dominate.There's no letting up in this crowd. Innovate or die.What's GOOGL Stock Worth?Ultimately
column28: the question is value: What do we pay?I like to compare the growth we're getting (earnings) with the price we're paying (price-to-earnings
column29: or P/E). This is called a price/earnings-to-growth ratio (PEG)
column30: and it's an intuitive way to compare apples to apples.Using 2017 consensus estimates tracked by Bloomberg
column31: GOOGL stock is tucked right in the middle of the pack. Its PEG ratio is 1.08. PEGs below 1 are cheap
column32: and PEGs approaching 2 are expensive.PEG ratios are revealing.First of all
column33: no one should buyMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT). It's neither a growth stock nor a value play.Alibaba Group Holding Ltd(NYSE:BABA) is a tad expensive
column34: but not excessively so
column35: especially since many consider ittheChinese consumer trading vehicle.Amazon is attractive
column36: so areApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) andFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB)
column37: both of which I have written up as longs and currently own.Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Has a New Hero: Services!Samsung(OTCMKTS:SSNLF)
column38: I admit is a mystery. It'ssocheap. I can only surmise its limited German and S. Korean listings deter U.S. investors
column39: as does the $1
column40: 700 stock price. It needs to split at least 10-to-1.The TradeSell the GOOGL April $800 puts at $20 to initiate a long-biased position.If the stock pulls back and trades through the $800 strike price
column41: I'm assigned shares and become a buyer. If Google continues making new highs
column42: I pocket the premium. I am content either way. Google's chart indicates initial technical support around $780
column43: and significant long-term support $700-$725.The reason I'm selling puts rather than buying the stock is because GOOGL stock has recently risen to a new all-time high. I know new highs tend to beget new highs (momentum traders buy strength)
column44: but I'm a value buyer at heart.Adam Johnson is Founder and Author ofBullseye Brief

column1: Can Facebook Inc (FB) Stock Jump Over These Hurdles?;2/1/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsAhead of earnings forFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB)
column3: which will come out at the end of trading on Wednesday
column4: investors are certainly upbeat. And why not? FB stock has been a pretty good bet.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockBut could things be different this time around? Maybe the enthusiasm for Facebook stock is too carried away?Well
column5: it is important to note that the valuation is still reasonable. The forward price-to-earnings ratio on FB stock is at about 25X. This compares to roughly 20X for bothAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column6: NASDAQ:GOOGL) andMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT). And these companies are not growing at anywhere near the pace of Facebook.What's more
column7: it seems like Facebook earnings should do fine in Q4. Revenues are expected to jump by 46% to $8.5 billion and adjusted EPS are forecasted to come to $1.31
column8: up from 79 cents during the same period a year ago. Keep in mind that - for the past five quarters - the company has beat the Street on both the top and bottom lines.FB Stock Still Faces Several RisksBut the real potential issue for Facebook stock is any disappointing commentary on the future growth trends. Interestingly enough
column9: on the Q3 earnings call
column10: the company's CFO had this ominous thing tosay: ""We continue to expect that revenue growth rates will decline in Q4 as we lap a strong fourth quarter in 2015. We also continue to expect that our total payments and other fees revenue in Q4 will be lower than it was in the fourth quarter of last year.""10 Stocks to Buy That Already Make America GreatNo doubt
column11: this should not be a surprise. As FB gets much larger
column12: it will increasingly get more difficult to churn out strong revenue numbers. It's the curse of the so-called ""law of large numbers.""Let's face it
column13: Facebook already has a massive user base. In the most recent quarter
column14: the number of monthly active users hit 1.79 billion
column15: up 16% on a year-over-year basis. There were also a stunning 1.2 billion daily users.But going forward
column16: what will the sources of new users be? It's hard to tell. But initiatives from FB show concerns. After all
column17: the company has been working hard to provide internet access to developing nations.And don't forget about China. According to a report from theWall Street Journal
column18: it appears that Facebook has made little progress. Instead
column19: rivals likeWeibo Corp(ADR)(NASDAQ:WB) andTencent(OTCMKTS:TCEHY) have been capitalizing on the opportunity.At the same time
column20: other problems could affect FB stock. For example
column21: during the last few months
column22: there have been various embarrassing stories about how the company has inflated certain metrics. Might this cause some pushback from advertisers?The Snapchat IPO: The Next Facebook Inc (FB) ... Or Twitter Inc (TWTR)?Then there is the ""fake news"" controversy. Granted
column23: the company has taken actions to improve the publishing of news
column24: such as with a focus on credible sources. But this could result in lower clicks and views
column25: which would slow down the revenue momentum for Facebook stock.Something else that could dampen some of the enthusiasm for FB stock: the upcoming Snapchat IPO
column26: which should hit the markets within the next couple of months. Of course
column27: there will be tremendous buzz and excitement. There will also be the inevitable comparisons to FB. In other words
column28: investors may look at Snapchat as an alternative to Facebook stock when seeking the next growth play.Overall
column29: Wednesday's earnings announcement will definitely be important. And if there are signs of deceleration on the top-line
column30: FB stock could be vulnerable
column31: especially since it has already pulled off a nice run for the year.Tom Taulli runs the InvestorPlace blogIPO Playbookand is a registered investment adviser representative (you canvisit his siteto learn more about his financial planning services).He is also the author of various books on investing like All About Commodities

column8: 2017This podcast was recorded on Jan. 19
column9: 2017.Sean O'Reilly:You mentioned how increasingly there's tech analysts there. It   might be just a happy coincidence that it was right after CES   [the Consumer Electronics Show]. Did it feel like a tech show   when you were there?John Rosevear:It has become really interesting. I didn't go to CES this year;   we had other folks from The Fool who were out there. But CES --   the Consumer Electronics Show
column10: which is in Vegas -- is also held   usually the first week of January every year
column11: has had more and   more of an automotive focus. Ford CEO Mark Fields was out there.MobileyeandDelphiwere demonstrating their new self-driving stuff out there.Fiat Chryslershowed off an electric concept minivan at CES. It's more and more   focused on autos
column12: future-tech autos.Then the press days run up until Wednesday or Thursday of that   week
column13: and then everything starts in Detroit the following Sunday.   It's just a couple days later; people fly straight in. This year
column14: it was very notable -- it was almost as if that conversation was   continuing on a separate track from the traditional show itself
column15: where they're unveiling the latest minivan and all that kind of   stuff.We had John Krafcik
column16: who heads up Waymo. Waymo is the company   under the Alphabet umbrella formerly known as the Google   Self-Driving Car Project. John Krafcik was in Detroit; he gave a   presentation on Sunday afternoon talking about the state of   Waymo's technology and what they're doing to test it and so   forth. He was clearly there talking to the auto industry
column17: talking   to the automakers.Waymo seems to be in ""let's make a deal"" mode right now. They   showed off the test car they created with Fiat Chrysler
column18: a   Waymo-ized version of the Chrysler Pacifica minivan
column19: which is   already kind of futuristic and sexy-looking. It's kind of   cool-looking; their self-driving sensors and stuff are much more   smoothly integrated. You can still tell it's a test car
column20: it still   has this big thing on the roof. But it looks more like something   you might see produced in the near future. They were running   around withToyotaand Lexus and Audi test vehicles with stuff tacked on for   years.But anyway
column21: to get back to the point
column22: there was a steady   discussion. Ford had a whole separate thing going on adjacent to   the show where they had speakers on future mobility. Ford is   trying to get into the business of helping cities come up with   mobility plans as electric cars
column23: self-driving
column24: ride-sharing
column25: and   so forth become more prevalent and more affordable as technology   advances. And this is a whole separate discussion that's going on   throughout the show
column26: aside from the traditional show itself
column27: where automakers are showing off their new vehicles to the global   media. It was really interesting
column28: the way this is going. And   there were several points in the show where I wished there had   been two of me
column29: because there were two things going on at the   same time that I really wanted to attend.Suzanne Frey

column1: Is Voice Search an Opportunity or a Threat to Google?;1/31/2017;"Image source: Google.Consumers are doing more and more web searches just by   talking. And they're not just asking the digital assistants on   their smartphones; they're also buying all-new devices
column2: such as   theAmazon.com(NASDAQ: AMZN) Echo and Google Home
column3: to answer random   queries.makeArticleAd();For Google
column4: the subsidiary ofAlphabet(NASDAQ: GOOGL) (NASDAQ: GOOG)
column5: the new trend in search is a   double-edged sword. On one hand
column6: it provides another point for   users to interact with its product. On the other
column7: Google doesn't   have a stranglehold on the device market
column8: and it isn't clear how   companies can monetize voice search with ads.Even as Google navigated the shift to mobile
column9: it still   fundamentally followed the same business model -- display ads   within search results. That's not possible with voice   searches.But Google CEO Sundar Pichai isn't concerned. ""I see more   opportunity than challenge
column10: when I think about voice search
column11: he   told analysts on the company's fourth-quarter earnings call. I   wouldn't be so sure he doesn't have that backward.Losing the hardware battleGoogle didn't provide any exact figures on the sales of its   new Google Home device. Pichai did say that ""Google Home was a   very popular present that many people opened on Christmas   morning
column12: but that was as detailed as he got.RBC analyst Mark Mahaney suggests that Google is getting   outsold 10-to-1 by competitors such as Amazon Echo. That presents   a real challenge for Google
column13: because without control over the   hardware
column14: it has no control over the user interface. That means   all those potential voice searches will go to someone else.Pichai points out that it's the very early days for devices   such as Google Home. And Google does have one big advantage over   Amazon and other competitors -- it's much better at search. ""When   I look at what it would take to voice search well
column15: our years of   progress we have done in areas like natural language processing   comes into play
column16: Pichai said on the call. To his credit
column17: Google Home has outperformed Alexain manyhead-to-head searchreviews.But smart-speaker hardware is about more than search
column18: and   Amazon's Echo is capable of integrating with more devices and   services than Google Home is. Google is certainly capable of   overcoming that through more strategic partnerships
column19: though. It   just released a development kit for businesses to integrate with   Google Home last month.One area that will be harder to overcome is how well Amazon   Echo works for Amazon Prime members. With tens of millions of   Prime members around the world
column20: it creates a pretty big moat for   Google Home to cross.But wait -- it gets tougherEven if Google closes the gap in hardware sales
column21: it still has   to find a way to turn voice search into a business. Hardware   sales won't move the needle for Alphabet
column22: which generated over   $90 billion in revenue last year.What's more
column23: Google has to sell the hardware near cost because   its biggest competitor
column24: Amazon
column25: does the same. The margins on a   Google Home device don't even come close to Google's 31%   operating margin in the fourth quarter.If Google is going to make some real money off of voice   search
column26: it needs to go beyond just getting its devices into   people's homes. Google's best idea so far is tofacilitate commerce through voice search. But if there's one company that has Google's number in   e-commerce search
column27: it's Amazon. Google will not win a battle   against Amazon in developing a personal shopping assistant
column28: no   matter how good its search capabilities are.Not just a challenge -- a threatThe growth of voice isn't just a challenge for Google. The   shift to voice represents a threat
column29: as it could result in a   decline in the amount consumers use Google search
column30: the company's   cash cow.Google is working to overcome the head start Amazon got in   smart speakers
column31: which accelerated the voice search trend. It   plans to expand its hardware lineup and invest more in 2017. But   as voice search continues growing and starts taking searches away   from mobile and desktop
column32: it will put pressure on Google to   continue developing new higher-value display and search ads for   its main desktop and mobile products.10 stocks we like better than Alphabet (A   shares)When investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column34: the newsletter they have run for   over a decade

column1: Is Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Resurrecting the Cursed Windows RT?;1/31/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsDon't look now
column3: butMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) looks to be taking another run atAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOGL
column4: NASDAQ:GOOG) Chrome operating system. References have begun popping up in builds of the Windows 10 Creators Update (which is due to arrive in April) to Windows 10 Cloud.makeArticleAd();Source: MicrosoftSpeculation is growing that Windows 10 Cloud is in fact a new simplified version of Microsoft's operating system
column5: designed to run on devices powered by inexpensive ARM chips fromARM Holdings plc (ADR)(NASDAQ:ARMH).In other words
column6: it appears that Microsoft is preparing to take on the threat of Chromebooks - the cheap
column7: popular laptops running Google's Chrome OS. And it seems to be doing so by resurrecting the idea of Windows RT.Windows 10 CloudWindows 10 Creators Build is the next major revision of the Microsoft Windows PC operating system. It's due to begin rolling out to users around April 17.The 5 Best Stocks to Buy for Big Emerging Markets ProfitsBut developers have been testing pre-release builds of Microsoft's software and recently some of them began to notice something strange: The code references different variations of the operating system. For example
column8: Windows 10 Pro for Workstation and Windows 10 for Enterprise are spiked out. Nothing unusual there. But then
column9: references to Windows 10 Cloud began to appear. And that started raising eyebrows - what is Windows 10 Cloud?ZDNet'sMary Jo Foley put the pieces together yesterday. Quoting unnamed sources
column10: she says that the mysterious Windows 10 Cloud is a new
column11: simplified version of Microsoft Windows that will run only Unified Windows Platform (UWP) apps. In other words
column12: it's a""simpler
column13: safer
column14: cheaper"" version of Windows 10.You might also think of it as another crack at Windows RT …Windows RT? But Why?Everyone remembers the mess that wasWindows RT. The attempt to shoehorn a version of Windows onto a consumer tablet running ARM chips -the ill-fated Surface RT - very nearly dealt MSFT's tablet aspirations a fatal blow.However
column15: despite the failure of Windows RT
column16: Microsoft has never given up on the idea of Windows on ARM chips. By doing so
column17: it can get Windows onto mobile devices that can't use the more powerful and expensive chips fromIntel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC). The company has already been showing offWindows 10 running in emulation on high-end ARM chips. As part of that effort
column18: it could also be working on a ""lite"" version that can deliver much of the Windows 10 experience on less expensive
column19: lower powered ARM hardware.So why
column20: why
column21: whywould Microsoft risk falling flat on its face again with what essentially amounts to another crack at Windows RT? There are two reasons.The first is that dream of ""Windows everywhere."" Having the full Windows 10 experience on high-powered ARM chips is great
column22: but only flagship smartphones and tablets can afford to use those chips. Windows 10 Cloud would get Microsoft Windows (and Bing) onto a whole lot more mobile hardware.The second is Google's Chrome OS and Chromebooks. These cheap laptops have been under Microsoft's skin for years. They've become extremely popular in the education sector thanks to low cost
column23: ease of use and built-in security. And Chromebooks have just kept selling
column24: to the point where last year they passed evenApple Inc.'s(NASDAQ:AAPL)MacBooks in sales.Microsoft has tried fighting back by helping manufacturers put out cheap Windows 10 laptops
column25: but that hasn't stemmed the Chromebook flood. Windows 10 makes for a sluggish experience on inexpensive Intel hardware
column26: it's far more complex than Chrome OS to use and lacks the drop-dead easy security of Chromebooks.Cash Out of Facebook Inc (FB) Stock Before EarningsWindows 10 Cloud running on laptops with ARM processors would compete head-to-head with Chromebooks running Chrome OS: simpler
column27: safer and cheaper than Windows 10.Microsoft refused to comment on theZDNetpost
column28: but the pieces pointing to Windows 10 as a Chrome OS-fighting
column29: second crack at Windows RT make sense. Naturally
column30: MSFT is going to avoid all references to Windows RT - that's poison - and the Windows 10 Cloud name could end up being a code name.It could also be an attempt to steal some of the Chrome OS ""cloud"" thunder. Expect to get the final answer on Windows 10 Cloud from Microsoft prior to that April 17 Windows 10 Creators Build release.As of this writing
column31: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace3 ""Golden"" Ammo Stocks to Buy for Big 2017 Returns3 Stocks to Buy for Better Deals Than the Great RecessionThe postIs Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Resurrecting the Cursed Windows RT?appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column3: 20% growth in total revenues
column4: and   30% non-GAAP earnings growth.Analysts expect MeetMe's revenue and non-GAAP earnings to   respectively rise 38% and 16% next year. Yet the stock trades at   just 7 times trailing earnings and 10 times forward earnings.   Let's take a look at the five key reasons investors aren't buying   MeetMe's growth story
column5: despite its high growth figures and low   valuations.MeetMe's mobile app. Image source: Google Play.makeArticleAd();1. A troubling history with sexual predatorsMeetMe lets users find new people in their area to chat with
column6: similar toMatch's(NASDAQ: MTCH) Tinder. While there's nothing inherently   sinister about the app
column7: there have been multiple reports of   MeetMe being used by sexual predators.In 2014
column8: the City of San Francisco sued MeetMe for the   unlawful publication of minors' profiles
column9: photos
column10: and geolocation   data
column11: and claimed that  the app ""enabled"" sexual predators   to find their victims. The city cited several cases involving   adult men and minors in which MeetMe was used. MeetMe settled the   case for $200
column12: 000 the  following year
column13: agreeing to clarify   and simplify its user agreements and settings
column14: and reducing the   amount of data displayed on minors to their city and state.But the cases involving MeetMe didn't cease -- last February
column15: a Buffalo man was  charged with multiple counts of child   pornography after using MeetMe to find minors. MeetMe's troubles   raised red flags at Tinder
column16: which hiked its age limit from 13 to   18 last June. Yet MeetMe still hasn't followed suit
column17: presumably   because it would lose a large portion of its users.2. The potential loss of ad revenuesYou'd think that big companies would be reluctant to advertise   on MeetMe
column18: but plenty of big brands still advertise on the app.   That's because MeetMe generates most of its ad revenues from   programmatic ads delivered byTwitter's(NYSE:TWTR) MoPub.This means that MoPub's customers simply pick a demographic --   in MeetMe's case
column19: younger users and Millennials -- and the   platform feeds the ads to various apps. This means that many   companies probably don't realize that their ads are appearing on   MeetMe.Therefore
column20: a common bear thesis is that MoPub could decide to   drop MeetMe due to violations of its terms of service
column21: or   advertisers could ask MoPub to pull their ads from the   controversial app. There's no evidence either of these scenarios   will occur
column22: but it raises a troubling question -- if MeetMe's   reputation worsens
column23: can it still keep growing its ad   revenues?3. Being booted from the app storesIn its 10-K filing for fiscal 2015
column24: MeetMe admits  that   its business will suffer if it is ""unable to maintain a good   relationship"" withAppleandAlphabet's Google. It notes that its app could be pulled from their app   stores ""if we violate"" or the companies believe ""that we have   violated"" their terms and conditions.The bulls might believe that's just a typical ""risk factor""   warning
column25: but MeetMe admits in the same filing that ""on more than   one occasion
column26: Apple rejected its app ""because of user generated   content and other concerns."" This indicates that another   high-profile lawsuit could knock MeetMe out of the app stores and   kill its business.4. Tinder is crushing MeetMeMeetMe arrived before Tinder
column27: which was initially launched in   2012. But over the past five years
column28: mainstream interest in MeetMe   waned in correlation with Tinder's growth
column29: as seen in this chart   from Google Trends:Image source: Google.That decline also explains why MeetMe acquired its competitor   Skout last  October. That move boosted the company's MAU   count from about 5 million to  8.5 million
column30: and greatly   inflated MeetMe's top and bottom line growth for fiscal 2016.5. The lack of insider confidenceIf MeetMe is as undervalued as the fundamentals suggest
column31: you'd   expect insiders to be loading up on shares. However
column32: MeetMe CEO   Geoffrey Cook just  sold 250
column33: 000 shares (16% of his entire   position) at an average price of $5.02.Including Cook's sales
column34: insiders sold  1.96 million   shares over the past 12 months
column35: but only bought 334
column36: 000 shares.   It's understandable that MeetMe's insiders would sell after the   stock's 50% rally over the past 12 months
column37: but it also indicates   that its upside potential could be limited.The key takeawayThe main lesson here is to always look beyond the valuations   and growth forecasts. On the surface
column38: MeetMe looks like a rapidly   growing social app maker trading at a discount to its peers. But   dig deeper
column39: and you'll see an app that's struggling to prove that   it's not a tool for criminals while remaining relevant against   Tinder
column40: which dominates the space with  over 50 million   active users.10 stocks we like better than MeetMeWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column41: it can pay to listen. After all
column42: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade

column1: 4 Reasons I'm Buying Baidu Inc. (ADR) Stock;1/31/2017;"Chinese search giantBaidu(NASDAQ: BIDU) is often dismissed as a slow-growth tech stock   that has run out of room to grow. Its heavy investments in   expanding its ecosystem into adjacent markets have weighed down   its bottom line growth
column2: making the stock seem like dead money.   Despite those challenges
column3: however
column4: I recently started a new   position in Baidu for four main reasons.Baidu Image Search. Image source: Author's screenshot.makeArticleAd();1. It's still the 800-pound gorillaBaidu controls roughly 80% of the internet search market in   China. That dominant position enables it to expand its ecosystem   in the same way asAlphabet's(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) Google. Its sprawling ecosystem   now includes Baidu Maps
column5: video streaming site iQiyi
column6: its Duer   voice assistant
column7: the Baidu Wallet payment platform
column8: numerous   portal sites
column9: and various O2O (online-to-offline) services in its   ""monolithic"" mobile app.While the profitability of these services varies greatly
column10: they   all help Baidu gather data from its users for targeted ads. Last   quarter
column11: Baidu's revenue per online marketing customer rose 10.6%   annually. This indicates that Baidu still remains a top   advertising pick in China
column12: even as other popular apps -- likeTencent's WeChat -- tether more users to their ecosystems. Moreover
column13: China still has an internet penetration rate of just 52%
column14: which   means that there may be plenty of room for all these companies to   expand without stepping on each other's toes.2. Its slowdown is temporaryBaidu fell out of favor with growth investors as its top and   bottom line growth seemingly dried up. Last quarter
column15: its revenue   fell  0.7% annually
column16: its core online marketing revenue slid   6.7%
column17: and its non-GAAP net income rose just 6.3%. Analysts expect   its  revenue to rise 6% this year
column18: but for its earnings to   decline 9%.However
column19: that slowdown was mainly caused by three temporary   headwinds. First
column20: Chinese regulators forced Baidu to remove   misleading pharmaceutical ads following the death of a student   who bought unapproved cancer drugs advertised on the site.   Second
column21: Baidu sold its stake in online travel agencyQunarto its rivalCtrip(NASDAQ: CTRP)
column22: essentially swapping its stake in Qunar for one   in Ctrip but temporarily throttling revenue growth.Lastly
column23: Baidu's heavy investments in R&D are squeezing its   margins
column24: but launching new services could boost its long-term   growth and widen its moat against rivals like Tencent. That's why   analysts believe that Baidu's revenue and earnings will   respectively rebound 21% and 33% in fiscal 2017.3. Growth potential in next-gen marketsLike Google
column25: Baidu is investing heavily in artificial   intelligence
column26: driverless cars
column27: and other ""next-gen"" technologies.   Machine learning and AI have become increasingly important to   search and advertising companies
column28: since they help gather more   data from users to create targeted ads that users are more likely   to click on. Baidu has been hiring a lot of top talent in that   field -- its chief scientist
column29: Andrew Ng
column30: previously led the   Google Brain AI project
column31: and its  new augmented reality   chief Qi Lu was aMicrosoftexec specializing in AI.To showcase its AI efforts
column32: Baidu pitted its AI robot against   Google's AlphaGo AI in a battle of facial and voice recognition   in early January. It partnered withNVIDIAand HERE Maps to develop mapping systems for autonomous vehicles
column33: and plans to launch a driverless shuttle bus in China in 2018. It   also partnered with  smart remote maker Peel to establish a   foothold in the growing smart home market. These projects   won't generate meaningful revenue for years
column34: but they could   greatly expand Baidu's O2O ecosystem over the long term.4. The stock is still cheapBaidu currently trades at just 13 times earnings
column35: which is   much lower than Google's P/E of 31 and the industry average of 50   for internet information providers. But due to its projected   decline in earnings this year
column36: the stock has a forward P/E of 30.   While that forward multiple doesn't seem cheap
column37: we should   remember that Baidu's earnings are expected to rebound in   2017.The key takeawayBaidu will likely remain weighed down by near-term challenges   over the next few quarters
column38: but it's still well-positioned to   profit from the long-term growth of the Chinese internet market.   Baidu may struggle to pull social users away from Tencent and   shoppers away fromAlibaba
column39: but its dominance of the search-based ad market won't end   anytime soon.10 stocks we like better than Alphabet (A     shares)When investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Alphabet Employees Protest Against Trump's Immigration Ban;1/31/2017;"Protests against Donald Trump's anti-immigration policy are gaining steam and the technology sector appears to be leading the way.  More than 2000Alphabet Inc.'sGOOGLGoogle employees staged protests against Trump's immigration ban by walking out of eight offices worldwide including the company's headquarters in Mountain View on Monday. Photos and videos of the walkouts have been tweeted using hashtag #GooglersUnite.Google co-founder Sergey Brin and CEO Sundar Pichai have extended their full support to the opposition.Concurrent with the protest
column2: Google created a $4 million fund to support immigrant rights groups like the Immigrant Legal Resource Center
column3: the American Civil Liberties Union
column4: the U.N. Refugee Agency and the International Rescue Committee.The protest was particularly against Trump's executive order to ban nationals of seven Muslim majority countries - Iraq
column5: Iran
column6: Somalia
column7: Libya
column8: Syria
column9: Sudan and Yemen - from coming to the U.S. Pichai denounced the order and stated that the ban affects about 187 Google employees.We note that not quite long ago
column10: Trump had called up technology leaders and urged them to create and retain jobs within the U.S. to which most of them had given their nods. However as the immigration ban order rolled out
column11: the sector is sending clear indications that it will not create jobs at the cost of preventing entry to external talent.Alphabet Inc. Free Cash Flow (TTM)Alphabet Inc. Free Cash Flow (TTM)|Alphabet Inc. QuoteProtests Across the Technology IndustryTrump's immigration restrictions have faced the flak of tech leaders in the form of tweets
column12: memos and statements. Chief executive officers of MicrosoftMSFT
column13: AppleAAPL
column14: NetflixNFLX
column15: Uber
column16: Airbnb and Tesla Motors have all indicated that they are against the decision.The technology sector recruits a big chunk outside talent and the survival of the sector could be at stake if immigration reduces or stops completely.The sector fears that Trump may overhaul the H1-B program that allows Silicon Valley to bring foreign engineers and technical experts to the U.S. for three to six years.Zacks Rank and Stock Price MovementAt present

column1: Will Twitter's Steps to Curb Hate Speech Revive User Growth?;1/31/2017;"Twitter Inc. (TWTR)will introduce measures to check trolling on its platform within this week. Ed Ho
column2: the vice president of engineering
column3: in a series of tweets
column4: said that in the coming days
column5: Twitter will start ""rolling out a number of product changes"" and ""tackle long overdue fixes to mute/block and stopping repeat offenders from creating new accounts."" He also added that management is working on making Twitter a ""safer platform"" with utmost ""urgency."" He refrained from giving a detailed explanation on the type of ""product changes"" that the company is mulling on.Twitter
column6: Inc. Price and ConsensusTwitter
column7: Inc. Price and Consensus|Twitter
column8: Inc. QuoteTwitter has been trying to contain the trolling menace that has plagued its platform for long now and has possibly kept potential users as well as buyers at bay. Women
column9: minorities as well the LGBT community often have been the target of ridicule on the platform.Reportedly
column10: in January this year
column11: a number of LGBT groups launched a campaign to urge Twitter to deal with the ""homophobic"" abuses posted on the social media site. Last year
column12: Twitter found itself in trouble after African American actress
column13: Leslie Jones was brutally trolled on the platform
column14: prompting her to quit for some time. However
column15: Twitter took swift action after Jones' complaint and banned several users for lifetime including Breitbart technology editor Milo Yiannopoulos. Also
column16: Twitter took down accounts of several so called ""alt-right"" to curb hateful conduct on its platform.Apart from taking down accounts of offenders
column17: Twitter also announced several measures to combat trolling. Twitter improvised the ""mute"" button
column18: which will enable users to block tweets that contain objectionable words
column19: phrases and conversations from their notification tabs. Plus
column20: the company empowered users by giving them a ""more direct way of reporting"" hateful conduct. Any Twitter user can now report any hateful conduct that they come across on the platform. Per Twitter
column21: this ""helps reduce the burden on the person experiencing the abuse
column22: and helps to strengthen a culture of collective support on Twitter."" The company said that it is also ""retraining"" its staff to better tackle abusive behavior on the platform.Twitter is going through one of the toughest phases in its corporate history. User growth is sluggish and advertising revenues are decelerating. Amid this entire fracas
column23: the exodus of high profile executives continues. In the past one year
column24: shares of Twitter declined 5.70% as against 9.91% rise in the ZacksInternet Softwareindustry. Its CEO Jack Dorsey's focus on ""live"" and user friendly changes hasn't yet moved the needle for Twitter.To top it
column25: the widely expected takeover didn't materialize with the interested parties ranging from AlphabetGOOGLto Salesforce to The Walt Disney CompanyDISpulling out last minute
column26: given the plethora of challenges that Twitter faces besides trolling.Will Twitter's new fixes help revive user growth? It remains a wait and see story.At present
